intro: Koeleria robinsoniana, commonly known as the Robinson's Koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually blue to purple in color, which bloom in late summer. Koeleria robinsoniana is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
